sentences: Kim Tae-yeon (Korean: 김태연; born March 9, 1989), known mononymously as Taeyeon, is a South Korean singer.

sentences: She debuted as a member of girl group Girls' Generation in August 2007, which went on to become one of the best-selling artists in South Korea and one of the most popular K-pop groups worldwide.

sentences: Having sold over one million physical albums and twenty million digital singles as of 2021, Taeyeon is one of the best-selling solo artists in South Korea.

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In the early years, Taeyeon's music was predominantly ballads recorded for television soundtracks.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: With the popularity of songs including "If" (2008) and "Can You Hear Me" (2009), she was referred to as the "representative singer of popular OSTs".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Since debuting as a solo artist, Taeyeon's musical styles have varied.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Her 2015 debut single "I" departs for a pop rock sound.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In 2016, the single "Rain" incorporates elements of jazz and R&B, while "Why" utilizes various elements including EDM, R&B and tropical house beats.

sentences: Voice and fashion =
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===
== Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Taeyeon has been widely regarded as a "talented vocalist" for her soulful vocals.
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Her singing abilities have been subject to attention from several major South Korean producers; in 2009 on MBC's Yoo Jae-suk & Kim Won-hee's Come to Play Park Jin-young of JYP Entertainment expressed his wish to work with Taeyeon because of her "ability to tell a story through singing."
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Korean composer Yoo Young-seok compared Taeyeon's singing to "a woman who has been divorced seven times."
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Taeyeon was selected as the best K-pop vocalist by 40 anonymous music industry officials in October 2015, and was named the best female vocalist in their twenties by twelve Korean music companies in April 2016.
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Music producer Jo Young-soo, who composed her song "Like a Star", was deeply impressed with how an outstanding idol vocalist is and how she can convey a variety of emotions.
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: As the leader of popular K-pop girl group Girls' Generation and a successful solo artist, Taeyeon has been recognized as a prominent South Korean figure.
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Janelle Okwodu from Vogue described Taeyeon as "the Beyoncé of [Girls' Generation]" whose fashion styles are "constantly on the go."
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Taeyeon topped Gallup Korea's listing of the most popular K-pop idols of 2016, based on public polls and opinions.
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: She also appeared on the rankings in 2015 (#3), 2017 (#9), and 2019 (#7).
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: She also appeared multiple times on Forbes Korea Power Celebrity, making the list in 2016 (#32), 2018 (#16), and 2019 (#23).
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: She became the first K-pop female celebrity to reach seven million followers on Instagram in June 2016 and has more than 16 million followers as of April 2021.
section: == Public image and impact == | === Voice and fashion ===

sentences: Other ventures ==

== Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: Endorsements ===
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: Taeyeon has been known as a 'completed piece' that fits diverse roles such as artist, beauty icon, and fashion-trend leader, especially in Asia.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: Given her popularity as a beauty icon, she has endorsed various Korean beauty brands since 2008.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: Besides her appearances in commercials and advertisements with Girls' Generation and Girls' Generation-TTS members, she began her solo brand advertising career with A-Solution, a brand of acne cosmetics, in 2008.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: Two years later, she became the first female Asia brand ambassador of Korean skincare brand, Nature Republic, along with boy group Exo from the same company SM Entertainment, for three consecutive years.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: In 2016, when Taeyeon's contract with Nature Republic ended, the cosmetic brand Banila Co. selected her to be its new spokesmodel for a variety of products because of her popularity not only domestically in South Korea but also across the entire world.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: In May 2020, Taeyeon become a muse for A'pieu, well-known Korean beauty subsidiary brand of Missha, of which its official brand representative claimed that "Taeyeon's pure atmosphere matches well to A'pieu's cosmetics."
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: In August 2021, she was selected as the ambassador for South Korean super-premium skincare beauty brand Sulwhasoo's "New Concentrated Ginseng Renewing EX" Campaign.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: Aside from her activities in the beauty industry, other endorsements included the bottled mineral water brand Jeju Samdasoo in 2016, Sword and Magic game of Kaokao Games in 2016, bakery café franchise brand Paris Baguette in 2017, nail-art product brand Gelato Factory in 2018 and 2019, Déesse Color Contact Lenses in 2018, and Hyundai's Haesang Direct Car Insurance in 2019.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: From 2013 to 2014, she was also the first and only foreign spokesperson of B-ing Collagen Drink by Singha, a large Thai beverage corporation.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: She featured in the B-ing's commercial films, broadcasting in various mass media channels including most Thai local television and many radio stations.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: She also appeared in B-ing Taeyeon's FinMeeting in Bangkok, a fan meeting sponsored by Singha.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: In July 2021, Taeyeon become the brand model for Young Pizza, with the company official stating that Taeyeon "fits perfectly" with their brand image of "demonstrating a healthy and bright brand image and positive and good influence on society".
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: She was selected as the model for Olive Young Omni Channel Campaign with Key in the same month.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===

sentences: On September 15, 2021, Taeyeon has been selected as the new muse of the contemporary streetwear brand model for Nerdy.
section: == Other ventures == | === Endorsements ===
